meanings.definition: Weakened or reduced in force, intensity, or value.
meanings.sent1: The attenuated sound of the distant thunder indicated the storm was moving away.
meanings.sent2: The attenuated light of the setting sun painted the sky in beautiful hues.
meanings.sent3: The attenuated power of the superhero's punch made the villain laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was attenuated by the negative feedback she received.
meanings.sent5: The attenuated aroma of the flowers filled the room with a delicate fragrance.

meanings.sent1: The attenuated branches of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The attenuated cat squeezed through the narrow gap in the fence.
meanings.sent3: The attenuated pencil struggled to write a bold statement.
meanings.sent4: Her attenuated figure glided gracefully across the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The attenuated thread held the delicate beads together in the necklace.

meanings.sent1: The attenuated fog obscured the view of the mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The attenuated fabric of the curtains allowed a soft glow to filter through.
meanings.sent3: The attenuated soup failed to satisfy the hungry guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The attenuated crowd dispersed quickly after the disappointing performance.
meanings.sent5: The attenuated layer of ice on the pond cracked under the weight of the skater.
